intro: Ardisia graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruits are bright red berries that mature in the fall, attracting various bird species. Ardisia graciliflora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal flowering.
